tags: David Tennant: Too Pure For This World?
summary: David Tennant calling Michael Sheen a “cheeky thankless bastard” & Michael admitting to using his fame (miracle-ing?) to get a...
caption:
David Tennant calling Michael Sheen a “cheeky thankless bastard” & Michael admitting to using his fame (miracle-ing?) to get a table at a restaurant is my entire mood right now.

Plus – when asked if they’ve ever stolen anything:

Michael Sheen: A few hearts…
David Tennant: Wah-hey!

summary: Don't say a prayer for me now Save it 'til the morning after No don't say a prayer for me now Save it 'til the morning after...
body:
Don’t say a prayer for me now
Save it ‘til the morning after
No don’t say a prayer for me now
Save it 'til the morning after

[Duran Duran - Save a Prayer]

Yesterday was my birthday, and I really needed to draw some stuff for myself. So, there’s somethings better of this two in new romantic / new wave clothes? I really need my 80’s vibes! Can you find all the references here? ;D

@goodomensamazon @neil-gaiman

summary: Thank God for Michael Sheen, the angel of Good Omens and fan art alike
title: Thank God for Michael Sheen, the angel of Good Omens and fan art alike
excerpt: The world of fandom is a celebration of all things we love. From fanfiction to fan art to vids and conventions, it's a multifaceted playground of enthusiasm and adoration. Fandom has no age, no nationality, no gender or sexuality. It's all of these things wrapped up in creativity and expression. It's a glorious thing.

kim | 20 | evil 
 but not really, come say wahoo

summary:
so no one talks about this? this is, i don’t know what it is, but it is gorgeous. this video offers:
-them awkwardly sitting on...
body:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j0p5D0_CLEo

so no one talks about this? this is, i don’t know what it is, but it is gorgeous. this video offers:

-them awkwardly sitting on those awful, awful excuses of a chair

-the LEGENDARY love story about sexy monsters, along with some damn good-bad puns

-the screech-laugh of a girl in the background

-sheens voice in it is so tasty, idk why, maybe its the mic, maybe its michael himself

-some wonderful ‘pranks’ from the both of them, bo burnham-style

-michael sometimes looks lost, but still delighted to be there

-this is some show from the 14s and i currently want to watch more

summary: What's up with the michael sheen is motherfucker unlimited post? I don't get it, did something happen? :D
question: What's up with the michael sheen is motherfucker unlimited post? I don't get it, did something happen? :D
answer: I think it’s a reference to his twitter and his wanton fandom related tweeting. Or it could just be that he’s DELIGHTFUL. Unclear, but to be fair, it seems like OP isn’t sure either.

summary: I honestly love how Michael Sheen interacts so much with the fandom! Retweeting fanart and commenting and such! It is really...
body:
I honestly love how Michael Sheen interacts so much with the fandom! Retweeting fanart and commenting and such! It is really lovely that he isn’t scared to do that! ❤❤❤❤

I just genuinely hope it doesn’t get too much for him. I hope he never feels that hes has to retweet or anything. And I most of all hope everyone is nice to him and don’t make it weird

reblog.comment:

I just genuinely hope it doesn’t get too much for him. I hope he never feels that hes has to retweet or anything. And I most of all hope everyone is nice to him and don’t make it weird

tags: peeps I feel like this particular bit of Sheen ephemera needs to be appreciated
I mean I know who he is but
I went looking to see if he was indeed in Bright Young Things forever ago
what am I supposed to do with this knowledge
summary: “Whenever he hears ‘Song to the Siren’ by Tim Buckley, he is reminded of his daughter's birth: ‘[t]here's a line it - Swim to...
body:
“Whenever he hears ‘Song to the Siren’ by Tim Buckley, he is reminded of his daughter’s birth: ‘[t]here’s a line it - Swim to me, let me enfold you - and it just makes me think of my daughter swimming to me.’ This recollection brings tears to his eyes and is his method of crying when filming.”

—Michael Sheen’s Wikipedia page

reblog.comment:
“Whenever he hears ‘Song to the Siren’ by Tim Buckley, he is reminded of his daughter’s birth: ‘[t]here’s a line it - Swim to me, let me enfold you - and it just makes me think of my daughter swimming to me.’ This recollection brings tears to his eyes and is his method of crying when filming.”

—Michael Sheen’s Wikipedia page

—Michael Sheen’s Wikipedia page
trail.content:
“Whenever he hears ‘Song to the Siren’ by Tim Buckley, he is reminded of his daughter’s birth: ‘[t]here’s a line it - Swim to me, let me enfold you - and it just makes me think of my daughter swimming to me.’ This recollection brings tears to his eyes and is his method of crying when filming.”

—Michael Sheen’s Wikipedia page
